BYU-Idaho's Community Connections Department will no longer be associated with the Boise Youth Spectacular. Please refer to this Letter to the Community for more information.  For information on future Boise Youth Spectacular programs, please contact the Boise institute at (208) 344-8549.

What is Boise Youth Spectacular (BYS)?

The Boise Youth Spectacular (BYS) is an engaging three-day testimony-building experience for youth held at the Boise State University (BSU) campus and the BSU LDS Institute of Religion. Workshops, games, a talent show, a dance, and a concert make for three days that the youth will never forget. Devotionals, a morningside, and a wholesome environment make for spiritual experiences that the youth will always remember.

 BYS Honor Code

Each participant is expected to demonstrate in their behavior (dress, speech, and actions), attitudes that reflect the gospel of Jesus Christ. Involvement in any kind of behavior or activity contrary will result in immediate dismissal from the Spectacular. Dress and grooming should always be modest, neat, and clean. Clothing should be modest in fabric, fit, and style. "Grubbies" are not appropriate. Clothing which is sleeveless, strapless, or revealing is not acceptable. Skirts and shorts must be knee length, and slits in dresses must not extend above the knee. Earrings may only be in the ear and may not be worn by males. Facial hair is not permissible for young men. Extreme hair colors/styles are not acceptable. All electronic devices, iPods, mp3s, and cell phones (except for counselors for emergencies) are prohibited.
